p: The antiviral effect of bortezomib was most pronounced when it was added at early time-points (0-8h) after infection, with a reduced effect between 16â€“32 hours post-infection (hpi), indicating that a post-entry step in the replication cycle was inhibited ( Fig 4B). The time-of-removal experiment revealed that removal of bortezomib at 16 hpi or earlier prevented its inhibitory effects ( Fig 4B). Furthermore, time-of-removal studies also showed that bortezomib treatment for the first 16h was necessary before its inhibitory effect could be observed.
